channel.title: The Guide To Hello World
channel.description:
[center][size=20pt][u][b]The Guide To Hello World[/b][/u][/size][/center]
You can find the complete tutorial here: http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/getStarted/cupojava/win32.html
Copyright 1995-2008 Sun Microsystems, Inc.(code,image)
[b]Requirements[/b] [b]1.[/b]To create a source file and compile it to make a class file.You will need the The Java SE Development Kit 6 (JDK 6). You can obtain that here: http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp To see the installation instructions,please go here http://java.sun.com/javase/6/webnotes/install/index.html
[b]Editors[/b] [b]2.[/b]You will need an editor,or a text document. In this tutorial i will be using Notepad,which can be easily found,open up cmd(Command Prompt) and type in notepad.
[b]3[/b].[b]Creating the source file[/b] Lets get started.You can do this two ways,the hard way or the easy way.The easy way is where i give you the download link to the source,and the hard way is you type the source in your self.Well i'll give you the easy way.You can get the source here: http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/getStarted/application/examples/HelloWorldApp.java
We will be looking at this part: [code]/** * The HelloWorldApp class implements an application that * simply prints "Hello World!" to standard output. */ class HelloWorldApp { public static void main(String[] args) { System.out.println("Hello World!"); // Display the string. } } [/code]
Put that in your text document i.d Notepad.And save it as HelloWorldApp.java
[b]Note:[/b] Don't get mistaken by helloworld.app.java It must be the same as the class,just like here: [code]class HelloWorldApp {[/code] So save it like this HelloWorldApp.java [IMG]http://i37.tinypic.com/pppp5.jpg[/img] Now click on save and exit out from your notepad.
[b]Getting the Class file (Compiling)[/b] [b]4.[/b]Click start than run and type in cmd.This will open up your command prompt.Now type in [i]cd C:\java[/i] This will change the prompt to [i]C:\java>[/i] [IMG]http://i33.tinypic.com/11l3f52.gif[/img]
[b]Note:[/b]It's better likely to put your source on your desktop,this is easier for the command prompt to pick it up. So move your source to your desktop,and type in [i]Javac HelloWorldApp.java[/i] [code]Javac[/code] Is also known as the compiler. Finaly click enter,and you should see a class file on your desktop,or where ever you put the source.It is better to put it on your desktop.
[b]Running The Application.[/b] [b]5.[/b] In the same directory [i]cd C:\Java[/i] Type in java HelloWorldApp and click enter. And you should see this: [IMG]http://i37.tinypic.com/2a4pr8j.gif[/img]
Congratulations you have completed the task!
Thank you for reading my first Java tutorial!
~MoparUnited~
